channel.title: Modkilled - A twist on Forum Mafia (Renegade, Disciples and Damafaud win!)
channel.description:
# :dagger: ~ [color=#ff0000]W[/color][color=#ff2000]e[/color][color=#ff4000]l[/color][color=#ff5f00]c[/color][color=#ff7f00]o[/color][color=#ff9f00]m[/color][color=#ffbf00]e[/color] [color=#ffff00]t[/color][color=#aaff00]o[/color] [color=#00ff00]M[/color][color=#00ff40]o[/color][color=#00ff80]d[/color][color=#00ffbf]k[/color][color=#00ffff]i[/color][color=#00bfff]l[/color][color=#0080ff]l[/color][color=#0040ff]![/color] ~ :gun:
### *Two Mods enter, one mod leaves.* #### Hosted by Marluxion and Damafaud
*The concept is simple. One mod is good and one is evil. The game ends when one of the mods is 'sacrificed'. Sacrifice the [color=#ee1717]E[/color][color=#c8191e]v[/color][color=#a21b25]i[/color][color=#7b1c2b]l[/color] [color=#713e2c]M[/color][color=#8e5d27]o[/color][color=#aa7d21]d[/color] and peace returns to the forums. Sacrifice the [color=#447294]G[/color][color=#5785a6]o[/color][color=#6a97b8]o[/color][color=#7caac9]d[/color] [color=#b1c5d1]M[/color][color=#d2cdc6]o[/color][color=#f4d6bc]d[/color] and the realm will be flooded with fake rolelists and unfair modkills..*
# **Rules**
[details="Standard FM Rules/Voting Rules"] Standard Forum Rules. No being an arse, cheating, spamming etc. **Days will last 72 Hours. Nights will last 36 hours. Extensions will not be granted for forgetting to send an action.** Voting is compulsive and plurality based! Majority is in effect! To vote someone up, you simply type **/vote playername** (bolding it is nice too.) When the majority of the group has voted for someone, they will be immediately sacrificed! Roles ARE revealed upon death! [/details]
[details="Special Modkill Rules"] The game has two mods! Each will be assigned a special rolecard randomly. **_The mods cannot directly speak to the players. (Other than Vote Checks and Lynch Flips.) During each night phase, the mods will be able to send one message to all players in the thread._** Mods CANNOT publicly reveal their alignment in any way, NOR can they directly reveal the class/alignment of any specific player. The nightly messages will be as cryptic as possible. **_The game begins with 10 Disciples of the Good Mod and 5 Cultists of the Evil Mod. One random player will be the Renegade. Not believing in either mod, The Renegade's only goal is to survive until the end._** The Cultists know who the Evil Mod is and who their teammates are. However, the disciples have no such luck. They only know their own alignment. **_The Cultists will have a day and night chat. ONLY The Evil mod will be able to see the chat, but cannot directly speak in it._** Each day, the church of the mod (you, the players) will vote to sacrifice one player to the mods. (A standard lynch.) Voting for No Lynch is an option. **_When 5 or less players remain, the [color=darkgrey]Ultimate Sacrifice[/color] will begin. The 5 remaining players will vote to sacrifice one of the two mods. **If the mod sacrificed is the Evil mod, the Disciples win! If the mod sacrificed is the Good Mod, the cultists win! (Regardless of who is alive.)_** [/details]
# [color=yellow] Role List [/color]
[details="Role List"]
[color=skyblue] Observant[/color] [color=skyblue] Observant[/color] [color=skyblue] Martyr[/color] [color=skyblue] Martyr[/color] [color=skyblue] Drunk[/color] [color=skyblue] Drunk[/color] [color=skyblue] Healer[/color] [color=skyblue] Healer[/color] [color=skyblue] Modeium[/color] [color=skyblue] Vessel[/color] [color=red] Cult Leader [/color] [color=red] The Eye[/color] [color=red] The Heart [/color] [color=red] The Tongue [/color] [color=red] Soulless Vessel [/color] [color=grey]The Renegade[/color] [/details]
# [color=darkorange]Role Cards[/color]
[details="Mod Role Cards"] > # [color=skyblue]The Good Mod[/color] >**Good Mod (Passive)** - You cannot be targeted by any abilities, you cannot speak and you cannot die. If you are sacrificed in the Ultimate Sacrifice, the cultists win. **Rise, my champion! (Day)** - _Publicly_ champion a player, granting them a **single-use** day ability that reads _[Modkill a single player. They will die immediately.]_ - 1 Use. **Modshield (Night)** - _Publicly_ protect a player from death and all negative effects tonight. The player protected will be announced at the start of the day phase. **Equality (Night)** - Target a disciple. Tonight, if they are attacked, their attacker will also die. (Will be publicly announced as modkilled.) - 1 Use.
> # [color=crimson]The Evil Mod[/color] >**Evil Mod (Passive)** - You cannot be targeted by any abilities, you cannot speak and you cannot die. If you are sacrificed in the Ultimate Sacrifice, the Disciples win. **Screw the Rules! (Day)** - _Publicly_ champion a player, granting them a **single-use** day ability that reads _[Modkill a single player. They will die immediately.]_, In addition to this, if the championed player is not a cultist, they will also die after using their ability. - 1 Use. **Modshield (Night)** - _Publicly_ protect a player from death and all negative effects tonight. If they are investigated, they will be seen as a disciple. The player protected will be announced at the start of the day phase. **Who needs to be fair? (Night)** - Kill a player. This cannot be stopped. (Will be publicly announced as modkilled.) - 2 Uses. [/details]
[details="Good Disciple Role Cards"] > # [color=skyblue] Observant [/color] > **Spy (Night)** - Check a player. You will determine if they are a cultist or not. - 2 Uses. *You win if the evil mod is sacrificed!*
> # [color=skyblue] Martyr[/color] > **Martyrdom (Night)** - Protect a player from death tonight. If they are attacked, both you and their attacker will die. Neither you nor the mod will die if the player is *modkilled.* - Unlimited Uses. *You win if the evil mod is sacrificed!*
> # [color=skyblue] Healer[/color] > **Mend Wounds (Night)** - Protect a player from death tonight. This does not protect from modkills. - 2 Uses. *You win if the evil mod is sacrificed!*
> # [color=skyblue] Drunk[/color] > **Party time! (Night)** - Roleblock a player. - 2 Uses. *You win if the evil mod is sacrificed!*
> # [color=skyblue] Modeium[/color] > **I see dead people... (Passive)** - Every night, you can communicate freely with all dead players. **Modlink (Night)** - In your rolecard, you may ask ONE mod a question and they will respond. - 1 Use. (Note, you may not ask a mod what alignment they are or another player is, or anything that would directly give an alignment or role. The good mod will answer honestly. The evil mod may choose to lie.) *You win if the evil mod is sacrificed!*
> # [color=skyblue] Vessel[/color] > **Temple Guards (Passive)** - You are immune to death and roleblocking while you remain a Vessel. **Quick Learner (Day)** - Target a dead disciple. At the start of the night, you will become that player's class. - 1 Use. *You win if the evil mod is sacrificed!* [/details]
[details="Evil Cultist Role Cards"] > # [color=red] Cult Leader [/color] > **Pass the Torch (Passive)** - There must always be a cult leader. When you die, target a living cultist and they immediately become the new Cult Leader. **Blood Sacrifice (Night)** - Attack a player. - Unlimited uses. *You win if the good mod is sacrificed!*
> # [color=red] The Eye [/color] > **Gaze (Night)** - Peer into a player's heart and learn their exact class. - 2 Uses. *You win if the good mod is sacrificed!*
> # [color=red] The Heart [/color] >**Sinister Compassion** - Target a cultist. Tonight, they will appear as a disciple to all investigations. - 3 Uses. *You win if the good mod is sacrificed!*
> # [color=red] The Tongue [/color] > **Deception (Night)** - Target two disciples. Tonight, they will appear as if they are cultists. - 2 Uses. *You win if the good mod is sacrificed!*
> # [color=red] Soulless Vessel [/color] > **Sheltered (Passive)** - You are immune to death and roleblocking while you are a Soulless Vessel. **Wicked Communion (Day)** - Target a dead cultist. **(Cannot target the original cult leader.)** At the start of the night, you will become whatever class they started as. You will permanently be able to chat with this dead cultist privately at all times. - 1 Use. *You win if the good mod is sacrificed!* [/details]
[details="The Renegade"] > # [color=grey]The Renegade[/color] > **Paranoia (Passive)** - You are immune to death. After you are attacked, the following day you will lose this passive. (So you're immune to any number of attacks ONCE.) **Battle Trance (Day)** - Tonight, you will be able to attack two players instead of one. - 1 use. **Killing Spree (Night)** - Kill a player. If you fail to kill your target, you will be unable to attack again for 1 night. *You will win if you live until the Ultimate Sacrifice!* [/details]
# Signups 1. Vulgard ~~2. Boss110~~ ~~3. NuclearBurrito~~ 4. Insanity ~~5. Hippolytus~~ ~~6. PolikShadowBliss~~ 7. Unknown 8. NightX ~~9. Celeste_Ludenberg~~ ~~10. Lymphoma~~ 11. Simon 12. Wolfy 13. PokemonKidRyan ~~14. Pug~~ 15. Techwolves 16. Namari
# **Spectators** Eevee (Also backup Mod) Sam17z CaptainNerbins (Backup)

item.title: Modkilled - A twist on Forum Mafia (Renegade, Disciples and Damafaud win!)
item.dc:creator: Unknown
item.description:
NightX:

Also how were we supposed to tell whether each mod was good or evil? It heavily biases the end to Cult, since if they’re all dead it’s random, while if they live they get an insta win.

Yeah normally(which is a problem, but I already said that). Here Marl was the proven Evil Mod because they somehow thought that they should lie to the Modeion with just 2 Cult alive. A terrible idea, especially because their information was obvious BS.

Read full topic

item.title: Modkilled - A twist on Forum Mafia (Renegade, Disciples and Damafaud win!)
item.dc:creator: NightX
item.description:
Feedback:

The fact that one mod can only use one power per night and they are all publicly announced allows confirmation (like how a modkill happened and PKR was shielded so that confirmed him)

Maybe it would be better if Modshield and Who needs to be fair/Equality could be used in the same night.

Another thing is that I think Modshield shouldn’t be usable every night, as the mods can completely negate all kills (like when I attacked Wolfy and Simon reeeeeeeeeeeeeee)

Also how were we supposed to tell whether each mod was good or evil? It heavily biases the end to Cult, since if they’re all dead it’s random, while if they live they get an insta win.

Also championing doesn’t work well when the second use of it always confirms someone, making it unusable by the mods.

And the fact that each Champion power is different means you can tell which mod did it. So I’d make each championing identical.

Read full topic
item.source: Modkilled - A twist on Forum Mafia (Renegade, Disciples and Damafaud win!)

item.title: Modkilled - A twist on Forum Mafia (Renegade, Disciples and Damafaud win!)
item.dc:creator: Unknown
item.description:
Reduce Cult down to 5.
Automatic wins:
Cult has at least 50% members at the US-> Cult wins.
Cult is dead at US or before->Disciples find out the evil mod and win
During US: No more modkills possible(champion)
Role list:
Observant
Martyr
Martyr
Drunk
Modeium
Vessel
Random Disciple*
Random Disciple
Random Disciple
Random Disciple
Random Disciple
Cult Leader
The Eye
The Heart
The Tongue
The Hand

Random Disciple:
Maximum of
2 Observants
5 Martyrs
2 Drunks
4 Healers
1 Modeium
1 Vessel
Role Changes:
Martyrdom is reduced to one use.
Mend Wounds reduced to one use.
Cult Leader:Blood Sacrifice (Night) Attack a player. Attack another player if a Cult member was killed last day or night.
The Hand: No Action(Night) The abilities of a player will not work; but they will not be notified. Does not work on Modeium. 4 uses.
Do not mess with the Hand(Passive):Ignores Roleblocks as long as it is the Hand

Ultimate Sacrifice begins with 6 members or less alive.

If the Modshield would prevent a Matyr from killing then the Matyr will die(instead of the attacked person) but the attacked player will identify the attacker.

Read full topic
item.source: Modkilled - A twist on Forum Mafia (Renegade, Disciples and Damafaud win!)
